Module project.chenlin_17
Package project.chenlin_17.Models

Class WorldController

java.lang.Object
project.chenlin_17.Models.WorldController
public class WorldController extends Object
This class is the controller of the game viewing and game playing status checker.
Version:
Version1.0
update: December 29th
Author:
Lin CHEN

    This function shows the final record screen when the game ends.

    step()
    This function simulates game playing status and continuously update the current game setting and the game status checker.
    It detects all the exceptions in the game playing process.
    It acts when the game ends and do the corresponding action.
    The highest score would be the user's score for each losing round.

  • Constructor Details

    • WorldController

      public WorldController(World world)
      This constructor sets the basic world settings of the world passed by the player and the initializes the game status.
      Parameters:
      world - world settings chosen by the player

  • Method Details

    • step

      private void step() throws IOException, InterruptedException
      This function simulates game playing status and continuously update the current game setting and the game status checker.
      It detects all the exceptions in the game playing process.
      It acts when the game ends and do the corresponding action.
      The highest score would be the user's score for each losing round.
      Throws:
      IOException - if loading fails
      InterruptedException - if loading fails

    • updateHighestScore

      private void updateHighestScore(int m_score)
      This function helps update the player's best score if he loses this round and needs to play again.
      Parameters:
      m_score - score received

    • showStatusScreen

      private void showStatusScreen() throws IOException, InterruptedException
      This function shows the final record screen when the game ends.
      There are two cases that the game will end, the first case is that the player loses three rounds, the second case is that the player wins.
      Throws:
      IOException - if loading fails
      InterruptedException - if loading fails

    • initialize

      public void initialize(javafx.stage.Stage m_Stage)
      This function aims at initializing the game board and make all the game settings visible on the pane
      Parameters:
      m_Stage - current game stage

    • setKeyInput

      public void setKeyInput(javafx.scene.Scene scene)
      This function helps gets the players' action from the keyboard and make corresponding actions.
      It associates with pressing ESC. SPACE. comnination of F1,Alt and SHIFT.
      Parameters:
      scene - current game scene

    • showPauseMenu

      private void showPauseMenu(String file) throws IOException
      This function helps show the pause menu or the power up menu by adding it to the scene root.
      Parameters:
      file - the file name for pausemenu, either the file name for debug panel or the pause menu
      Throws:
      IOException - if load menu fails

    • setWindowFocus

      public void setWindowFocus(javafx.stage.Window window)
      This function pauses the game when the window focus lost.
      Parameters:
      window - current window

    • backToScene

      public void backToScene()
      This function allows the user to close the pause menu or the power up menu.

    • getM_Root

      public javafx.scene.layout.Pane getM_Root()
      This function allows others to get the current game settings and the checker.
      It is used for the index page's directing.
      Returns:
      game setting and the checker

    • resetM_GameChecker

      public void resetM_GameChecker(GameStatusModel gameStatus)
      This function reset the current gameStatus to be a new one since it may need updates.
      It is used by the some functions in the pause menu and power up menu pane.
      Parameters:
      gameStatus - expected or newly created game status

    • getM_World

      public World getM_World()
      This function get the current game world setting.
      Returns:
      current game world setting

    • getM_GameChecker

      public GameStatusView getM_GameChecker()
      This function get the current game playing status.
      Returns:
      current game playing status
